description.$t: 0219059 Trina (red) and her sister Sheree (yellow) are ready for their forever homes! They will be on the smaller side for a lab mix. They can be a bit shy for the first minute or so but after a couple of treats they will be your best friend!

0119029 - Hi, I am CJ, I am about a 3 month old spayed puppy. We have no idea what I am mixed with. I currently weigh about 14 pounds. I get nervous if my humans try and pick me up. Once I am being held or lying next to them on the couch, I am not so nervous. I love playing and cuddling with my foster siblings. I have not had an accident in the house in over a week. I like going for walks and am learning how to walk on a leash. If you are willing to give me time to get comfortable around you, please fill out and application at www.SloppyKisses.org/adoptions

Webster is a 3 month old Chiweenie that was saved from death row. Webster is a nice dog who just needed a chance out of the shelter environment in order to flourish and be ready for adoption. He has been neutered, vaccinated, microchipped, and has been dewormed. Webster is working on all the obedience items (house training, crate training, general commands, etc.) and would love to be part of a family that keep him occupied as part of daily routine. Webster is $300 to adopt.

The Petfinder application does not include enough information for us to process your request. If you are interested in adopted an animal please go to our website: http://lifeisbetterrescue.org/pages/adoptionapp.html (note: you must copy and paste link). Applications must be submitted through the Life is Better website in order for us to consider your request. Any applications received from Petfinder will not be considered. We do not do out of state adoptions.

Please visit our website at mamcorescue.org to see more available dogs. Each of our dogs lives in foster care. Therefore, it is easiest to meet multiple litters during one of our adoption events. Please visit our Facebook Page for event details and times: https://www.facebook.com/MAMCORescue/

Nova is a 10 week old puppy. She loves to play and is a typical puppy. Her adoption fee is $350 plus a refundable $75 spay deposit that is returned once sheâs big enough to be fixed. Please apply at mgarcolorado.org.

Tamara is a year old terrier mix. Sheâs got a bubbly and sweet personality, but a timid pup. Sheâs come a long way in her foster home where she is completely comfortable and sheâs been enjoying going to the off leash dog park. She should be in home with no small children, however, because it is very stressful to her. She likes to be with her people, but loves to be with the other dogs and should be in a home with another dog. She really gets comfortable with a confident dog to share space with. Sheâs up to date on shots and dewormed. Her spay and microchip is covered under the adoption fee. Her adoption fee is $300.

Teddy is a 10 week old prissy girl. She prefers a sweater, so she doesnât get cold. She loves to play and is a typical puppy. Her adoption fee is $350 plus a refundable $75 spay deposit that is returned once sheâs big enough to be fixed. Please apply at mgarcolorado.org.

Ginger's mom is a petitie cattle dog mix weighing only 25 lbs so we expect Ginger to be around the same weight range as an adult. Ginger turned 8 weeks old on February 20th and weighs about 5 lbs. Just like mom, she is a tiny bundle of adorable sweetness. Mom has medium energy so we expect that the puppies will mirror her calm demeanor. Ginger is a very unique, carmel brown color and is just as cute as can be!

If you would like to adopt, please complete an application at https://www.circle2rescue.com/dog-adoption-application/ The adoption fee of $350 includes the spay/neuter, vaccinations, microchip and dewormer. Adopters are responsible for keeping up on the booster vaccinations. Puppies need DAPP booster shots every 3-4 weeks until they have received a series of 3 vaccinations. The spay/neuter is included at our partner vet Spay Today in Lakewood. We collect a $250 deposit check to ensure the adopter gets the puppy spay/neutered. We don't cash it unless proof of spay/neuter has not been provided by the time the puppy is 6 months old.

Please note, Circle 2 Rescue cannot guarantee the breed, composition or ages of our dogs as we usually have no history prior to them entering the rescue. We make every effort to ensure the dogs are healthy.
